titleStmt.title: Von Ludwig Wittgenstein an George Edward Moore, 5. 3. 1914
titleStmt.author: Wittgenstein, Ludwig

sourceDesc.p: Original bei Timothy Moore; Kopie im BA. Publiziert (Letters, S. 149; deutsch: Briefe, S. 53; Cambridge Letters, S. 81; WiC, S. 72).

list.item: 2007/06: Conversion from Folio Flat File to XML

div.p: Only a few lines because I'm just now in the right moode. First of all: write soon when exactly you're going to come to Bergen. Secondly: come soon. Thirdly: I've got out lots of new logical stuff. (I don't dare to say more). Fourthly: If you see Johnson please give him my kindest regards. Fifthly: if you see Muscio please tell him that he's a beast (he'll know why). Sixthly: once more â€’ come soon. That's all.
